name: 2kings
text: damn computers are ruining our lives!

name: heyman
text: Cough, HAcK, Dear god I'm choking on irony

name: thoughtpolluter
text: This is the moral of the Johnny Pneumonic movie.

name: nonanon
text: A part of me hopes that you purposely used 'pneumonic' instead of 'mnemonic,' but the rest of me knows that you didn't.

name: farvana
text: That movie has been silently staring at me, sullen like, from my roommate's movie collection.  I have not seen it for I am led to believe it is a horrible thing.

name: tripleg
text: replace horrible with hilarious and you're pretty right on.

name: fancyrat
text: God damn yes i read the novelization somehow.

name: dartigen
text:
...I am saddened at this. The novelisation is so good.
I hope they didn't ruin the scene on the Killing Floor in the movie.

name: crowrobot
text: Wasn't it a book FIRST?

name: fattypneumonia
text: I.  WANT.  ROOM SERVIIIIIIIIIICE!!!!

name: userbeliever
text:
just read this instead:
http://project.cyberpunk.ru/lib/johnny_mnemonic/

name: belgand
text: Johnny Pneumonic was a gay porno movies that also wasn't very good. Oh, wait, no, I am wrong. That was Johnny Pneumatic. Johnny Pneumonic was about the struggle of a young boy serving with in the revolutionary army during the American Revolution. It was quite good. I do not wish to spoil the film, but he gets pneumonia.

name: heccibiggs
text: I chubbied this before I even finished reading the comment. I got to the end and felt no regret.

name: alilsneaky
text: It's a funny strip but theres alot of truth in it and the author probably thought so too as he decided to put the idea in comic form.

name: chamberk
text: Ray is a man of great ideas.

name: owangutang
text: Love the sentiment in this one.

name: drskradley
text: I both love and abhor your avatar at the same time.

name: falseprophet
text:
Cowlick dude approves of the loss of Little Red Riding Hood's innocence. He approves it... eagerly .

I wish I could chubby the both of your avatars collectively because they work so well together as one.

name: wigglestick
text: A comment left by wigglestick was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Jesler729, sigmacoder, Zem, Panserbjorne)

name: stormagnet
text: Daaaaaamn dude. Go watch Army of Darkness now. Before it's too late.

name: shirono
text: This is probably my favorite strip, for the sentiment.

name: fattypneumonia
text:
Chubbied for the rough-chuckles inducing probable source of your avatar:

[IMGS OFF]

name: sex_bicycle
text: your aviator is fucking amazing

name: sex_bicycle
text: *avator damn lack of edit i shall lame myself i deserve it

name: mercuri0us
text: avatar.

name: sex_bicycle
text: you just want me do go kill myself don't ya, i fail at internet.

name: mercuri0us
text:
No, please don't do it, you're still cool.

But you meant to say "...to go kill myself"

name: sex_bicycle
text: i now fail at internet! goes and gets rope ready.

name: mercuri0us
text: No, no! Here, have a chubby.  Now, doesn't that make you feel better?  :)

name: sex_bicycle
text: my first chubby YAY!

name: dusty
text: mercuri0us must see potential in you as a poster, he seems to have taken you under his wing. Perhaps it was the excellently chosen reference in your name that won you a place in his heart.

name: mercuri0us
text: Nah, I was just trying to virtual-score.

name: whitey
text: We definitely got too much stimuluses.

name: the_doz
text: Achewood is my substitute for an imagination that was destroyed by the internet.

name: hamishl
text: My friend thought that Ray in this strip was me, so I started reading Achewood

name: juancarlos
text: I read too much into achewood strips, I just see Ray being alarmed at being jaded, and then making a conscious decision to go to the store, get the most un-hip toy and enjoy playing with it.

name: saint
text: ray's grammar is proof of everything he says.

name: woodenteeth
text: Tonka. TONKA!

name: never_die
text:
Teodor is FOCUSED on imagination.
"SINKHOLE!"

(Ray is having so much fun in the first panel. I wish we all had our own personal dumptruck.)

name: zem
text: They're at the toy store, dude! Go grab one!

name: petitegitan
text: I completely got chills with the fun being had in this strip.

name: saru
text:
But we have the Internet!
No, wait, wait, there was a nice senator man who straightened this out for me... the Internet is not a dump truck. That's right. Sorry for getting your hopes up.

name: killingthejay
text: the internet is the biggest diaper ever.

name: carlyle
text: It's not a really a diaper, it's like a large glass bowl that everyone can see the shit inside but nobody can get it off you to change it.

name: ford
text: The thing of it is, "series of tubes" actually works pretty well for explaining the internet to someone who doesn't understand what it is.

name: tombsgrave
text:
You're never too old to derive fun from representative pieces of plastic.

I got a Megatron, myself.

name: trevor
text: This one is just facts, plain and simple.

name: fattybeaver
text: Quick throw it in reverse! *beep beep*

name: peterjoel
text: I hope you realise, with your avatar, you don't actually need to add anything worthwhile to get a chubby..

name: chuchurocket
text: i'd say that pretty much sums up the male to female interaction.

name: soticoto
text:
Not entirely.
I don't know many females who can make them move independantly like that... when just standing still.

It would be SO awesome if they could though.

name: ananke
text: She changed the setting on her breasts from "stun" to "kill."

name: cbtbone
text:
I'm imagining a little dial, in the center of every woman's back, with different settings. Wouldn't that be funny? Am I right?.....

...I've never seen a woman naked.

name: mercuri0us
text: Well, when you do, you will find out it's actually the nipple, which needs only a need press.

name: mercuri0us
text: language

name: gus
text:
Elvira can do cute tricks with them. If I remember rightly, in her movie theres a scene where she's wearing these tassel pasties, and makes the tassels spin around one way, then spin around the other.

Damn, I need to rent that movie for that reason alone.

name: zem
text: this is kind of fucked up because my mom's name is elvira

name: carlyle
text: I'd like to buy the rights to this film sir.

name: rowboat
text: Not often does an message board avatar tap into and wreak havoc on my basest urges. I think I might hate it for that. But I can't look away. It's just eternity, man. Every second of every day, they're here, doing that....

name: achilleselbow
text: If you really wanted to cure yourself of this predicament, I imagine a well-photoshopped picture of the above combined with the face of a strongly bearded man might do the trick by creating a permanent association (unless you're into that sort of thing), but I have neither the software nor the skill.

name: rowboat
text:
I don't wanna get over,
the sweetest hangover.

name: dtuba
text:
chubbied for titties & truck noises.....

....love them

name: patkun
text: When ray sets his mind to something, no amount of doubt or mockery will shift him.

name: rad_chillies
text:
Kid kid kid, what's with all this kid imagery? Do you see any kid here?

I love this one so much. I had a similar experience long before I started reading Achewood. My friend and I make crude drawings of dinosaurs and erupting volcanoes, the whole time making explosion noises with our mouths. Spit flying everywhere. I also make an excellent machine gun, in case you're wondering.

name: sexualhomeboy
text:
The ability to make excellent machine gun noises with your mouth is a primary characteristic of the Y chromosome.
I hear genetic scientists look for the machine gun noise gene as a marker when searching for other, less obnoxious genes on the Y.

name: choosebro
text: I enjoy making Star Wars style laser sounds with my mouth whenever I watch anything to do with Space. I enjoy to do this even when there are no lasers being fired.

name: soticoto
text: ... And even when there are no noises in space.

name: dancinggollum
text:
... and even when lasers don't make noise, anyway.

But I am still in favor of making Star Wars laser noises when Space is at hand. Bravo.

name: rowboat
text: TIE fighter. Best sound effect ever.

name: soticoto
text:
Seconded.
I'd chubb that, but I ran out on this page.

That said, it doesn't sound as awesome from the inside. I remember playing Collector Edition TIE Fighter for hours when I was younger, but it doesn't sound the same on the inside for obvious reasons. =(

name: rowboat
text: On the inside of the TIE Fighter? Damn, I never considered that angle.

name: ketelcat
text: Yes indeed

name: roastbeet
text:
Half my kingdom for the T-shirt: "I play with this truck!" Little toy dumptruck picture optional.

Being misinterpreted in a redneck way would be one of many side benefits.

name: lolsworth
text: What is your kingdom

name: littlefatdog
text: deep philosophy in this one. i think we could all use a little play with some trucks.

name: letterswewrote
text: this is definitely reminiscent of watterson somehow...

name: stuart
text: Actually, sucking on a pacifier was so you wouldn't bite off your own tounge tripping on X.

name: stuart
text: *TONGUE*

name: philosophe
text: That would basically never happen. But is nice to have something to chew on other than your teeth.

name: heccibiggs
text: Maybe he meant tripping in the most literal sense, as in there is some X on the floor, and you trip over it, and bite through your tongue upon landing.

name: zoom
text:
This comic is me, post surgery, with Princess Leis on a speeder.

FANTASTIC, WOULD GIVE MULTIPLE 5's

name: zoom
text: Leia, damnit.

name: dasilodavi
text: This really is an important lesson.  I'm actually very excited that they can do this without the whole thing becoming a drinking contest.  It gives me hope for my future as an adult who has fun.

name: phthoggos
text: although those are fun too

name: henrythecad
text:
I read this comic every morning. Ray's face and words in the last panel remind me why i still show off my figurines, against my girlfriends will.

Let this be a lesson to all of you.

name: sexualhomeboy
text: Hummel figurines don't count.

name: splendorr
text: "Showing off your figurines" is NOT the same thing as legitimately, innocently "playing with toys." One is the result of unchecked consumerism and misplaced nostalgia, whereas the other is you just playing with toys. Think carefully about this.

name: hcaz
text: I love how Ray rates T's style with the truck.

name: nigelchaos
text: Yes. I have MUSCLE figures all posing next to my TV.. I don't play with them often.. but it's nice to know I could.

name: pyro_ike
text: Yet more proof that there needs to be a book called "The Zen of Ray."

name: saru
text:
I didn't much like action figures or toy trucks as a kid, actually. I never saw the appeal.
But by god do I still rock my Legos.

name: saru
text: DAMN YOU NEUTRAL/PRO/CON DROP DOWN! YOU'VE FAILED ME FOR THE LAST TIME!

name: werewolves
text: A comment left by werewolves was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Dovey, invidious, Deusoma, Jhunter, dj_insomniac, stormagnet, Satyr)

name: dj_insomniac
text: Take that back. Infidel.

name: werewolves
text: A guy who brags about his math skills every day ain't a guy I'd want to have at my wedding, is all I'm saying.

name: dj_insomniac
text: No, you wouldn't want to have him at your wedding because he'd tell stories like this at it.

name: theryuujin
text: I found Achewood because XKCD linked to it. It's like they're related. They're linked .

name: mtrott
text: I wish I could chubby this twice.

name: vincentkv
text: In the drawer next to my bed, Wolverine sleeps.

name: soticoto
text:
I have two Steve Irwin toys by my television. One of them is a wind-up toy of him on a crocodile's back that will scoot around in circles on the ground quite merrily if I wind it up. The other one has a few of his more memorable catchphrases at the press of a button. Sometimes I will press it if I'm feeling down... or need advice.

Steve-O .... we will miss you.
Rest in peace...

name: aelindil
text: I miss my little red tractor so much right now.

name: vandenbos
text:
After going on about this strip for awhile now, I actually received a toy dumptruck for Christmas.
Also some dinosaurs.

name: bumfighter
text: Ray's slack-jawed amusement in the first panel gets me every time.

name: rowboat
text:
Yeah, Teodor. Just 'cause Ray's black means it has to be a "new hip-hop thing." Real cool, man.

For a long time, I've considered the honor of "Best Stand-Alone Strip" (yes, this is Official) to be tied between "Ray Gets Sort Of Stoned" and "Mickey Mouse Pancake." But, going through the archives a second time, I think this is really both strips' peer. It's just so purely good.

name: drago25
text: Ray is a beautiful creature

name: checkmatejones
text: I don't know why I didn't always think this was my favorite strip.

name: afronaut
text: This is my favorite last panel of any achewood

name: krispykorn
text: I've read over achewood a couple times, but I don't ever recall reading this comic! It's like there were two new comics today! Awesome!

name: mrchee
text: where the fuck are achewood comics like this today?  Now its all "Graphic novel of the Year" this and "GQ" that

name: ryanfuss
text: Strips like this just reconfirm my love for Ray. I'm jaded.

name: chexmix
text: SO true. All of it.

name: phel
text: Favorite strip of all time. Makes me want to play LEGO, playmobile, and bust out the Alien franchise toys i got and do a battle of the ages like old times. Cant forget the city blocks carpet and hot wheels too!

name: greenkoolayd
text: using my imagination is chronic.  i cant not use it.

name: deus
text: TRUE TRUE AND EVEN MORE TRUE!!!!

name: cycerin
text: This reminds me a lot of "Naiv. Super" by Erlend Loe
